info.author: Benjamin Rigaud
info.description:
================
pytest-reporting
================

.. image:: https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/pytest-reporting.svg
    :target: https://pypi.org/project/pytest-reporting
    :alt: PyPI version

.. image:: https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/pytest-reporting.svg
    :target: https://pypi.org/project/pytest-reporting
    :alt: Python versions

A plugin to report summarized results in a table format

----

This `pytest`_ plugin was generated with `Cookiecutter`_ along with `@hackebrot`_'s `cookiecutter-pytest-plugin`_ template.


Features
--------

* TODO


Requirements
------------

* TODO


Installation
------------

You can install "pytest-reporting" via `pip`_ from `PyPI`_::

    $ pip install pytest-reporting


Usage
-----

* TODO

Contributing
------------
Contributions are very welcome. Tests can be run with `tox`_, please ensure
the coverage at least stays the same before you submit a pull request.

License
-------

Distributed under the terms of the `MIT`_ license, "pytest-reporting" is free and open source software


Issues
------

If you encounter any problems, please `file an issue`_ along with a detailed description.

.. _`file an issue`: https://gitlab.com/too-many-programmers/pytest-reporting/issues
.. _`Cookiecutter`: https://github.com/audreyr/cookiecutter
.. _`@hackebrot`: https://github.com/hackebrot
.. _`MIT`: http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT
.. _`cookiecutter-pytest-plugin`: https://github.com/pytest-dev/cookiecutter-pytest-plugin
.. _`pytest`: https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest
.. _`tox`: https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
.. _`pip`: https://pypi.org/project/pip/
.. _`PyPI`: https://pypi.org/project
